name: Windsor Bone China teacup and saucer (blue flowers)
description: This is a vintage Windsor bone china tea cup and matching saucer with gold gilt edges and blue flower pattern. Both cup and saucer are in excellent condition. Using a tea cup and saucer is encouragement to slow down and enjoy everything more. Drinking tea from a china teacup shouldn't just be for special occasions.  And it's very pretty for your home.

name: Phoenix China vintage teacup and saucer (flower pattern)
description:
This is a lovely china teacup and matching saucer with purple hand-painted flowers, gold gilt edges and detailing.  

The bottom stamp shown from Thomas Forester & Sons can be looked up, it was used between the years 1925 to 1959 - Phoenix China, T.F. & S Ltd, Made in England. 

Both cup and saucer are in great condition, although there are a a couple of tiny anomalies in the gilt edges of the cup. If you are looking for an antique in utterly mint condition this isn't it. However, if you're looking for a nearly-mint and charming addition to your antique bone china collection and even plan to actually use it (which would be my hope), it would make a lovely addition. Tea from a china cup shouldn't just be for special occasions. And it's very pretty for your home.

name: Windsor Bone China teacup and saucer (thistle pattern)
description:
This is a vintage Windsor bone china tea cup and matching saucer with gold gilt edges and thistle pattern.  

The glaze is starting to show subtle crackle, and there are a couple of pin-prick size anomalies in the gilt edges.  If you are looking for an antique in utterly mint condition this isn't it.  However, if you're looking for an excellently preserved and charming addition to your antique bone china collection and even plan to actually use it (which would be my hope), it would make a lovely addition. Drinking tea from a china teacup shouldn't just be for special occasions.  And it's very pretty for your home.

name: 1950's Child's mug and bowl by Wade Irish Porcelain
description: This is a vintage child-sized mug and bowl with leprechaun and toadstool pattern and speckled blue, green and gray glaze traditional to Wade Irish Porcelain (made ca. 1954). Both pieces are solid, they have a pleasing weight to them. The mug measures 3" deep and 2.5" across. The bowl measures 2" deep and almost 5" across. Both pieces are in excellent condition.
